meanings.definition: Full of or covered with knurls; gnarled; knotty.
meanings.sent1: The old tree had knurly branches that twisted in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The knurly surface of the rock made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent3: The knurly roots of the plant seemed to be playing a game of twister underground.
meanings.sent4: His knurly hands grasped the rough rope, feeling every twist and turn.
meanings.sent5: The knurly texture of the fabric reminded her of a tangled web.

meanings.sent1: The knurly rope was difficult to untangle after being used for so long.
meanings.sent2: She admired the knurly pattern of the wood grain on the table.
meanings.sent3: The knurly yarn created a bumpy texture in her knitting project.
meanings.sent4: The knurly roots of the tree reached deep into the ground, anchoring it firmly.
meanings.sent5: His knurly hair stood out in wild tufts, giving him a unique look.
